title: How to Cook Butternut Squash in the Oven

steps.headline: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees Fahrenheit (180 degrees Celsius).
steps.description:
Prepare a roasting pan or deep baking dish by lightly coating the bottom with cooking spray. You could also coat the pan in butter or cover it with aluminum foil to prevent the squash from sticking to the bottom. {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/d\/d6\/Cook-Butternut-Squash-in-the-Oven-Step-1Bullet1.jpg\/v4-459px-Cook-Butternut-Squash-in-the-Oven-Step-1Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/d\/d6\/Cook-Butternut-Squash-in-the-Oven-Step-1Bullet1.jpg\/v4-759px-Cook-Butternut-Squash-in-the-Oven-Step-1Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":306,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":506.31868131868134,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons<\/a>
\n<\/p>


\n<\/p><\/div>"}

steps.headline: Divide the squash into quarters.
Place the squash in your prepared roasting pan.
steps.description: The quarters should be cut-side up.

steps.headline: Cover the squash with oil, butter, salt, and pepper.
Roast for 45 to 50 minutes.
steps.description:
The squash should be tender enough to stick a fork into. The entire squash may not be browned, but you should begin seeing golden-brown patches developing, especially along the edges. {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/2\/2a\/Cook-Butternut-Squash-in-the-Oven-Step-5Bullet1.jpg\/v4-459px-Cook-Butternut-Squash-in-the-Oven-Step-5Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/2\/2a\/Cook-Butternut-Squash-in-the-Oven-Step-5Bullet1.jpg\/v4-759px-Cook-Butternut-Squash-in-the-Oven-Step-5Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":306,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":506.31868131868134,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons<\/a>
\n<\/p>


\n<\/p><\/div>"}

steps.headline: Remove from oven.
steps.description: Let cool slightly before serving warm.

steps.headline: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees Fahrenheit (180 degrees Celsius).
steps.description:
Prepare a baking sheet with shallow sides. You do not need to grease the baking sheet, but if desired, you can spread a layer of nonstick aluminum foil over the bottom to prevent the squash from sticking to the pan. {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/f\/fb\/Cook-Butternut-Squash-in-the-Oven-Step-7Bullet1.jpg\/v4-459px-Cook-Butternut-Squash-in-the-Oven-Step-7Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/f\/fb\/Cook-Butternut-Squash-in-the-Oven-Step-7Bullet1.jpg\/v4-759px-Cook-Butternut-Squash-in-the-Oven-Step-7Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":306,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":506.31868131868134,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons<\/a>
\n<\/p>


\n<\/p><\/div>"}

steps.headline: Place squash onto the baking sheet.
steps.description:
Use a sharp knife to prick the squash in several places. Each prick should be between 1 and 2 inches (2.5 and 5 cm) deep, and the pricks should be roughly 3 to 4 inches (7.6 and 10.2 cm) apart. {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/7\/76\/Cook-Butternut-Squash-in-the-Oven-Step-8Bullet1.jpg\/v4-459px-Cook-Butternut-Squash-in-the-Oven-Step-8Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/7\/76\/Cook-Butternut-Squash-in-the-Oven-Step-8Bullet1.jpg\/v4-759px-Cook-Butternut-Squash-in-the-Oven-Step-8Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":306,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":506.31868131868134,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons<\/a>
\n<\/p>


\n<\/p><\/div>"}

steps.headline: Bake for 60 minutes.
steps.description:
The squash should be tender enough to easily stick a fork into. Leave the squash uncovered as you bake it. {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/f\/fa\/Cook-Butternut-Squash-in-the-Oven-Step-9Bullet1.jpg\/v4-459px-Cook-Butternut-Squash-in-the-Oven-Step-9Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/f\/fa\/Cook-Butternut-Squash-in-the-Oven-Step-9Bullet1.jpg\/v4-759px-Cook-Butternut-Squash-in-the-Oven-Step-9Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":306,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":506.31868131868134,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons<\/a>
\n<\/p>


\n<\/p><\/div>"}

steps.headline: Remove from oven and cut in half.
Season the squash and serve it.
Preheat oven to 425 degrees Fahrenheit (218 degrees Celsius).
steps.description: Line a large baking sheet with shallow sides using parchment paper or nonstick aluminum foil.

steps.headline: Peel and slice the squash.
Coat the squash with oil.
Sprinkle the squash with salt.
steps.description: The amount of salt you use is a matter of personal taste, but start with anywhere from 1/2 to 1 tsp (2.5 to 5 ml) for the entire batch if you are uncertain.

steps.headline: Bake for 15 to 20 minutes.
steps.description: The slices should begin to turn a slight golden brown around the edges.

steps.headline: Turn the slices and continue baking.
steps.description:
Flip each slice and sprinkle with additional salt. Continue baking for 15 more minutes. Use tongs to flip the slices since they will be too hot to handle with your bare hands. {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/a\/a8\/Cook-Butternut-Squash-in-the-Oven-Step-17Bullet1.jpg\/v4-459px-Cook-Butternut-Squash-in-the-Oven-Step-17Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/a\/a8\/Cook-Butternut-Squash-in-the-Oven-Step-17Bullet1.jpg\/v4-759px-Cook-Butternut-Squash-in-the-Oven-Step-17Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":306,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":506.31868131868134,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons<\/a>
\n<\/p>


\n<\/p><\/div>"}

steps.headline: Switch on the broiler.
steps.description: If your broiler has multiple settings, switch it to the low setting.

steps.headline: Broil for 5 minutes.
steps.description: The squash should begin to turn dark brown in some places. Monitor the squash closely. If some portions cook faster than others, remove them first.

steps.headline: Serve warm.
steps.description: After pulling the charbroiled slices out of the oven, let cool for 5 minutes or so and serve warm.

steps.headline: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees Fahrenheit (180 degrees Celsius).
steps.description: Prepare a 9- by 13-inch (23- by 33-cm) glass baking dish. Greasing the dish or covering it with aluminum foil is unnecessary.

steps.headline: Cut the squash in half.
Place the squash in the baking dish and fill with water.
steps.description: The halves should be cut-side down. Add 1/2 cup (125 ml) cool to lukewarm water to the dish. The water helps to prevent the squash from sticking and also creates steam, which aids in the cooking process.

steps.headline: Cover with foil.
steps.description:
Tightly cover the top of the dish with aluminum foil. If using nonstick foil, make sure that the nonstick side faces down toward the squash. {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/4\/48\/Cook-Butternut-Squash-in-the-Oven-Step-24Bullet1.jpg\/v4-459px-Cook-Butternut-Squash-in-the-Oven-Step-24Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/4\/48\/Cook-Butternut-Squash-in-the-Oven-Step-24Bullet1.jpg\/v4-759px-Cook-Butternut-Squash-in-the-Oven-Step-24Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":306,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":506.31868131868134,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons<\/a>
\n<\/p>


\n<\/p><\/div>"} Pinch the foil around the edges of the baking dish to ensure a tight seal.

steps.headline: Bake for 60 minutes.
steps.description:
The squash should be tender enough to poke with a fork after it finishes. You may not notice any change in color. {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/1\/10\/Cook-Butternut-Squash-in-the-Oven-Step-25Bullet1.jpg\/v4-459px-Cook-Butternut-Squash-in-the-Oven-Step-25Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/1\/10\/Cook-Butternut-Squash-in-the-Oven-Step-25Bullet1.jpg\/v4-759px-Cook-Butternut-Squash-in-the-Oven-Step-25Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":306,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":506.31868131868134,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons<\/a>
\n<\/p>


\n<\/p><\/div>"}

steps.headline: Mash the inside of the squash with butter, brown sugar, and cinnamon.

text:
Roasted[1] X Research source Preheat the oven to 350 degrees Fahrenheit (180 degrees Celsius). Prepare a roasting pan or deep baking dish by lightly coating the bottom with cooking spray. You could also coat the pan in butter or cover it with aluminum foil to prevent the squash from sticking to the bottom. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/d/d6/Cook-Butternut-Squash-in-the-Oven-Step-1Bullet1.jpg/v4-459px-Cook-Butternut-Squash-in-the-Oven-Step-1Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/d/d6/Cook-Butternut-Squash-in-the-Oven-Step-1Bullet1.jpg/v4-759px-Cook-Butternut-Squash-in-the-Oven-Step-1Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":306,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":506.31868131868134,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"} Divide the squash into quarters. Use a sharp serrated knife to cut the squash into quarters lengthwise. Cut the squash in half from top to bottom. Use a sawing motion. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/8/81/Cook-Butternut-Squash-in-the-Oven-Step-2Bullet1.jpg/v4-459px-Cook-Butternut-Squash-in-the-Oven-Step-2Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/8/81/Cook-Butternut-Squash-in-the-Oven-Step-2Bullet1.jpg/v4-759px-Cook-Butternut-Squash-in-the-Oven-Step-2Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":306,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":506.31868131868134,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"} Cut each half in half, again working from top to bottom in a sawing motion. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/a/a8/Cook-Butternut-Squash-in-the-Oven-Step-2Bullet2.jpg/v4-459px-Cook-Butternut-Squash-in-the-Oven-Step-2Bullet2.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/a/a8/Cook-Butternut-Squash-in-the-Oven-Step-2Bullet2.jpg/v4-759px-Cook-Butternut-Squash-in-the-Oven-Step-2Bullet2.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":306,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":506.31868131868134,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"} Peeling the squash is not necessary. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/a/a4/Cook-Butternut-Squash-in-the-Oven-Step-2Bullet3.jpg/v4-459px-Cook-Butternut-Squash-in-the-Oven-Step-2Bullet3.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/a/a4/Cook-Butternut-Squash-in-the-Oven-Step-2Bullet3.jpg/v4-759px-Cook-Butternut-Squash-in-the-Oven-Step-2Bullet3.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":306,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":506.31868131868134,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"} Use a metal spoon or melon-baller to remove the seeds and stringy pulp. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/f/fd/Cook-Butternut-Squash-in-the-Oven-Step-2Bullet4.jpg/v4-459px-Cook-Butternut-Squash-in-the-Oven-Step-2Bullet4.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/f/fd/Cook-Butternut-Squash-in-the-Oven-Step-2Bullet4.jpg/v4-759px-Cook-Butternut-Squash-in-the-Oven-Step-2Bullet4.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":306,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":506.31868131868134,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"} Place the squash in your prepared roasting pan. The quarters should be cut-side up. Cover the squash with oil, butter, salt, and pepper. Coat the upward-facing, cut-side of each quarter. Drizzle a generous amount of olive oil over each quarter. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/7/75/Cook-Butternut-Squash-in-the-Oven-Step-4Bullet1.jpg/v4-459px-Cook-Butternut-Squash-in-the-Oven-Step-4Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/7/75/Cook-Butternut-Squash-in-the-Oven-Step-4Bullet1.jpg/v4-759px-Cook-Butternut-Squash-in-the-Oven-Step-4Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":306,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":506.31868131868134,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"} Divide the butter equally among all the quarters. Dot the cut surface with small chunks of butter. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/e/ec/Cook-Butternut-Squash-in-the-Oven-Step-4Bullet2.jpg/v4-459px-Cook-Butternut-Squash-in-the-Oven-Step-4Bullet2.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/e/ec/Cook-Butternut-Squash-in-the-Oven-Step-4Bullet2.jpg/v4-759px-Cook-Butternut-Squash-in-the-Oven-Step-4Bullet2.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":306,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":506.31868131868134,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"} Sprinkle salt and pepper over the squash. This should be done according to taste, but if you are uncertain where to start, use roughly 1/4 tsp (1.25 ml) salt and 1/8 tsp (0.62 ml) pepper per quarter. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/4/45/Cook-Butternut-Squash-in-the-Oven-Step-4Bullet3.jpg/v4-459px-Cook-Butternut-Squash-in-the-Oven-Step-4Bullet3.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/4/45/Cook-Butternut-Squash-in-the-Oven-Step-4Bullet3.jpg/v4-759px-Cook-Butternut-Squash-in-the-Oven-Step-4Bullet3.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":306,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":506.31868131868134,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"} Additional herbs and seasonings can also be used. For instance, you can sprinkle the squash with thyme or parsley for a savory taste or a dash of red pepper for a spicier flavor. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/2/2b/Cook-Butternut-Squash-in-the-Oven-Step-4Bullet4.jpg/v4-459px-Cook-Butternut-Squash-in-the-Oven-Step-4Bullet4.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/2/2b/Cook-Butternut-Squash-in-the-Oven-Step-4Bullet4.jpg/v4-759px-Cook-Butternut-Squash-in-the-Oven-Step-4Bullet4.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":306,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":506.31868131868134,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"} Roast for 45 to 50 minutes. The squash should be tender enough to stick a fork into. The entire squash may not be browned, but you should begin seeing golden-brown patches developing, especially along the edges. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/2/2a/Cook-Butternut-Squash-in-the-Oven-Step-5Bullet1.jpg/v4-459px-Cook-Butternut-Squash-in-the-Oven-Step-5Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/2/2a/Cook-Butternut-Squash-in-the-Oven-Step-5Bullet1.jpg/v4-759px-Cook-Butternut-Squash-in-the-Oven-Step-5Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":306,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":506.31868131868134,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"} Remove from oven. Let cool slightly before serving warm. Baked Whole[2] X Research source Preheat the oven to 350 degrees Fahrenheit (180 degrees Celsius). Prepare a baking sheet with shallow sides. You do not need to grease the baking sheet, but if desired, you can spread a layer of nonstick aluminum foil over the bottom to prevent the squash from sticking to the pan. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/f/fb/Cook-Butternut-Squash-in-the-Oven-Step-7Bullet1.jpg/v4-459px-Cook-Butternut-Squash-in-the-Oven-Step-7Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/f/fb/Cook-Butternut-Squash-in-the-Oven-Step-7Bullet1.jpg/v4-759px-Cook-Butternut-Squash-in-the-Oven-Step-7Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":306,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":506.31868131868134,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"} Place squash onto the baking sheet. Use a sharp knife to prick the squash in several places. Each prick should be between 1 and 2 inches (2.5 and 5 cm) deep, and the pricks should be roughly 3 to 4 inches (7.6 and 10.2 cm) apart. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/7/76/Cook-Butternut-Squash-in-the-Oven-Step-8Bullet1.jpg/v4-459px-Cook-Butternut-Squash-in-the-Oven-Step-8Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/7/76/Cook-Butternut-Squash-in-the-Oven-Step-8Bullet1.jpg/v4-759px-Cook-Butternut-Squash-in-the-Oven-Step-8Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":306,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":506.31868131868134,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"} Bake for 60 minutes. The squash should be tender enough to easily stick a fork into. Leave the squash uncovered as you bake it. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/f/fa/Cook-Butternut-Squash-in-the-Oven-Step-9Bullet1.jpg/v4-459px-Cook-Butternut-Squash-in-the-Oven-Step-9Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/f/fa/Cook-Butternut-Squash-in-the-Oven-Step-9Bullet1.jpg/v4-759px-Cook-Butternut-Squash-in-the-Oven-Step-9Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":306,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":506.31868131868134,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"} Remove from oven and cut in half. Allow the squash to cool slightly before cutting it in half lengthwise. Wait at least 10 to 15 minutes after pulling the squash out of the oven. Otherwise, it might be too hot for you to handle, and you could end up burning your fingers. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/b/be/Cook-Butternut-Squash-in-the-Oven-Step-10Bullet1.jpg/v4-459px-Cook-Butternut-Squash-in-the-Oven-Step-10Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/b/be/Cook-Butternut-Squash-in-the-Oven-Step-10Bullet1.jpg/v4-759px-Cook-Butternut-Squash-in-the-Oven-Step-10Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":306,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":506.31868131868134,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"} Use a serrated knife to split the squash open from top to bottom. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/0/00/Cook-Butternut-Squash-in-the-Oven-Step-10Bullet2.jpg/v4-459px-Cook-Butternut-Squash-in-the-Oven-Step-10Bullet2.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/0/00/Cook-Butternut-Squash-in-the-Oven-Step-10Bullet2.jpg/v4-759px-Cook-Butternut-Squash-in-the-Oven-Step-10Bullet2.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":306,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":506.31868131868134,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"} Dig out the seeds and stringy fibers with a metal spoon or melon-baller. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/c/c8/Cook-Butternut-Squash-in-the-Oven-Step-10Bullet3.jpg/v4-459px-Cook-Butternut-Squash-in-the-Oven-Step-10Bullet3.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/c/c8/Cook-Butternut-Squash-in-the-Oven-Step-10Bullet3.jpg/v4-759px-Cook-Butternut-Squash-in-the-Oven-Step-10Bullet3.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":306,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":506.31868131868134,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"} Season the squash and serve it. Sprinkle it with salt and pepper, to taste. Use as much salt and pepper as desired. If you are uncertain about how much to use, start with 1/2 tsp (2.5 ml) salt and 1/4 tsp (1.25 ml) pepper per half. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/4/4b/Cook-Butternut-Squash-in-the-Oven-Step-11Bullet1.jpg/v4-459px-Cook-Butternut-Squash-in-the-Oven-Step-11Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/4/4b/Cook-Butternut-Squash-in-the-Oven-Step-11Bullet1.jpg/v4-759px-Cook-Butternut-Squash-in-the-Oven-Step-11Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":306,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":506.31868131868134,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"} If desired, you can also drizzle the halves with melted butter or a little olive oil. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/0/08/Cook-Butternut-Squash-in-the-Oven-Step-11Bullet2.jpg/v4-459px-Cook-Butternut-Squash-in-the-Oven-Step-11Bullet2.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/0/08/Cook-Butternut-Squash-in-the-Oven-Step-11Bullet2.jpg/v4-759px-Cook-Butternut-Squash-in-the-Oven-Step-11Bullet2.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":357,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":590.2912621359224,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"} For a tangier twist, consider drizzling the squash with lime juice. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/d/de/Cook-Butternut-Squash-in-the-Oven-Step-11Bullet3.jpg/v4-459px-Cook-Butternut-Squash-in-the-Oven-Step-11Bullet3.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/d/de/Cook-Butternut-Squash-in-the-Oven-Step-11Bullet3.jpg/v4-759px-Cook-Butternut-Squash-in-the-Oven-Step-11Bullet3.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":306,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":506.31868131868134,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"} To make the squash easier to serve, you may wish to cut the halves in half again, ultimately dividing the squash into quarters. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/4/47/Cook-Butternut-Squash-in-the-Oven-Step-11Bullet4.jpg/v4-459px-Cook-Butternut-Squash-in-the-Oven-Step-11Bullet4.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/4/47/Cook-Butternut-Squash-in-the-Oven-Step-11Bullet4.jpg/v4-759px-Cook-Butternut-Squash-in-the-Oven-Step-11Bullet4.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":306,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":506.31868131868134,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"} Charbroiled[3] X Research source Preheat oven to 425 degrees Fahrenheit (218 degrees Celsius). Line a large baking sheet with shallow sides using parchment paper or nonstick aluminum foil. Peel and slice the squash. Use a vegetable peeler to shave off the peel and a sharp knife to cut the squash into 1-inch (2.5-cm) slices. Cut 1 inch (2.5 cm) from the top and bottom of the squash. Discard pieces. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/a/af/Cook-Butternut-Squash-in-the-Oven-Step-13Bullet1.jpg/v4-459px-Cook-Butternut-Squash-in-the-Oven-Step-13Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/a/af/Cook-Butternut-Squash-in-the-Oven-Step-13Bullet1.jpg/v4-759px-Cook-Butternut-Squash-in-the-Oven-Step-13Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":306,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":506.31868131868134,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"} Use a serrated vegetable peeler to remove the thick skin until you reveal the orange flesh beneath. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/f/f2/Cook-Butternut-Squash-in-the-Oven-Step-13Bullet2.jpg/v4-459px-Cook-Butternut-Squash-in-the-Oven-Step-13Bullet2.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/f/f2/Cook-Butternut-Squash-in-the-Oven-Step-13Bullet2.jpg/v4-759px-Cook-Butternut-Squash-in-the-Oven-Step-13Bullet2.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":306,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":506.31868131868134,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"} Use a metal spoon or melon-baller to scoop out the seeds and fibers inside. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/6/6d/Cook-Butternut-Squash-in-the-Oven-Step-13Bullet3.jpg/v4-459px-Cook-Butternut-Squash-in-the-Oven-Step-13Bullet3.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/6/6d/Cook-Butternut-Squash-in-the-Oven-Step-13Bullet3.jpg/v4-759px-Cook-Butternut-Squash-in-the-Oven-Step-13Bullet3.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":306,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":506.31868131868134,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"} Make width-wise slices, cutting from side to side, that are each about 1 inch (2.5 cm) thick. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/c/ce/Cook-Butternut-Squash-in-the-Oven-Step-13Bullet4.jpg/v4-459px-Cook-Butternut-Squash-in-the-Oven-Step-13Bullet4.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/c/ce/Cook-Butternut-Squash-in-the-Oven-Step-13Bullet4.jpg/v4-759px-Cook-Butternut-Squash-in-the-Oven-Step-13Bullet4.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":306,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":506.31868131868134,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"} Coat the squash with oil. Drizzle the oil over the baking sheet and directly over the slices. Olive oil works well, but you can also use walnut oil or other types of vegetable oil. Drizzle half of the olive oil over the baking sheet. Dredge each slice in the oil, turning it over so that both sides get covered. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/1/14/Cook-Butternut-Squash-in-the-Oven-Step-14Bullet2.jpg/v4-459px-Cook-Butternut-Squash-in-the-Oven-Step-14Bullet2.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/1/14/Cook-Butternut-Squash-in-the-Oven-Step-14Bullet2.jpg/v4-759px-Cook-Butternut-Squash-in-the-Oven-Step-14Bullet2.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":306,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":506.31868131868134,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"} Drizzle the remaining oil directly over each slice. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/5/52/Cook-Butternut-Squash-in-the-Oven-Step-14Bullet3.jpg/v4-459px-Cook-Butternut-Squash-in-the-Oven-Step-14Bullet3.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/5/52/Cook-Butternut-Squash-in-the-Oven-Step-14Bullet3.jpg/v4-759px-Cook-Butternut-Squash-in-the-Oven-Step-14Bullet3.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":306,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":506.31868131868134,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"} If desired, you can also spray the slices with cooking spray. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/0/0c/Cook-Butternut-Squash-in-the-Oven-Step-14Bullet4.jpg/v4-459px-Cook-Butternut-Squash-in-the-Oven-Step-14Bullet4.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/0/0c/Cook-Butternut-Squash-in-the-Oven-Step-14Bullet4.jpg/v4-759px-Cook-Butternut-Squash-in-the-Oven-Step-14Bullet4.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":306,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":506.31868131868134,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"} Sprinkle the squash with salt. The amount of salt you use is a matter of personal taste, but start with anywhere from 1/2 to 1 tsp (2.5 to 5 ml) for the entire batch if you are uncertain. Bake for 15 to 20 minutes. The slices should begin to turn a slight golden brown around the edges. Turn the slices and continue baking. Flip each slice and sprinkle with additional salt. Continue baking for 15 more minutes. Use tongs to flip the slices since they will be too hot to handle with your bare hands. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/a/a8/Cook-Butternut-Squash-in-the-Oven-Step-17Bullet1.jpg/v4-459px-Cook-Butternut-Squash-in-the-Oven-Step-17Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/a/a8/Cook-Butternut-Squash-in-the-Oven-Step-17Bullet1.jpg/v4-759px-Cook-Butternut-Squash-in-the-Oven-Step-17Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":306,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":506.31868131868134,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"} Switch on the broiler. If your broiler has multiple settings, switch it to the low setting. Broil for 5 minutes. The squash should begin to turn dark brown in some places. Monitor the squash closely. If some portions cook faster than others, remove them first. Serve warm. After pulling the charbroiled slices out of the oven, let cool for 5 minutes or so and serve warm. Steam-Baked[4] X Research source Preheat the oven to 350 degrees Fahrenheit (180 degrees Celsius). Prepare a 9- by 13-inch (23- by 33-cm) glass baking dish. Greasing the dish or covering it with aluminum foil is unnecessary. Cut the squash in half. Use a sharp serrated knife to divide the squash in half lengthwise. Cut the squash in half from top to bottom. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/9/9a/Cook-Butternut-Squash-in-the-Oven-Step-22Bullet1.jpg/v4-459px-Cook-Butternut-Squash-in-the-Oven-Step-22Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/9/9a/Cook-Butternut-Squash-in-the-Oven-Step-22Bullet1.jpg/v4-759px-Cook-Butternut-Squash-in-the-Oven-Step-22Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":306,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":506.31868131868134,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"} Peeling is not necessary or desired. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/f/f5/Cook-Butternut-Squash-in-the-Oven-Step-22Bullet2.jpg/v4-459px-Cook-Butternut-Squash-in-the-Oven-Step-22Bullet2.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/f/f5/Cook-Butternut-Squash-in-the-Oven-Step-22Bullet2.jpg/v4-759px-Cook-Butternut-Squash-in-the-Oven-Step-22Bullet2.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":306,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":506.31868131868134,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"} Scoop out the seeds and pulp with a metal spoon or melon-baller. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/d/d5/Cook-Butternut-Squash-in-the-Oven-Step-22Bullet3.jpg/v4-459px-Cook-Butternut-Squash-in-the-Oven-Step-22Bullet3.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/d/d5/Cook-Butternut-Squash-in-the-Oven-Step-22Bullet3.jpg/v4-759px-Cook-Butternut-Squash-in-the-Oven-Step-22Bullet3.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":306,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":506.31868131868134,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"} Place the squash in the baking dish and fill with water. The halves should be cut-side down. Add 1/2 cup (125 ml) cool to lukewarm water to the dish. The water helps to prevent the squash from sticking and also creates steam, which aids in the cooking process. Cover with foil. Tightly cover the top of the dish with aluminum foil. If using nonstick foil, make sure that the nonstick side faces down toward the squash. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/4/48/Cook-Butternut-Squash-in-the-Oven-Step-24Bullet1.jpg/v4-459px-Cook-Butternut-Squash-in-the-Oven-Step-24Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/4/48/Cook-Butternut-Squash-in-the-Oven-Step-24Bullet1.jpg/v4-759px-Cook-Butternut-Squash-in-the-Oven-Step-24Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":306,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":506.31868131868134,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"} Pinch the foil around the edges of the baking dish to ensure a tight seal. Bake for 60 minutes. The squash should be tender enough to poke with a fork after it finishes. You may not notice any change in color. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/1/10/Cook-Butternut-Squash-in-the-Oven-Step-25Bullet1.jpg/v4-459px-Cook-Butternut-Squash-in-the-Oven-Step-25Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/1/10/Cook-Butternut-Squash-in-the-Oven-Step-25Bullet1.jpg/v4-759px-Cook-Butternut-Squash-in-the-Oven-Step-25Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":306,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":506.31868131868134,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"} Mash the inside of the squash with butter, brown sugar, and cinnamon. If desired, scoop out the softened flesh and place it into a large bowl. Use a potato masher to mash brown sugar, butter, and cinnamon into the squash. Wait several minutes after pulling the squash out of the oven before handling it. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/7/7f/Cook-Butternut-Squash-in-the-Oven-Step-26Bullet1.jpg/v4-459px-Cook-Butternut-Squash-in-the-Oven-Step-26Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/7/7f/Cook-Butternut-Squash-in-the-Oven-Step-26Bullet1.jpg/v4-759px-Cook-Butternut-Squash-in-the-Oven-Step-26Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":306,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":506.31868131868134,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"} You can also serve the squash without mashing it. Simply divide the squash into quarters or however many pieces you desire. Sprinkle it with brown sugar, butter, and cinnamon, or try different seasonings, like salt and pepper. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/2/29/Cook-Butternut-Squash-in-the-Oven-Step-26Bullet2.jpg/v4-459px-Cook-Butternut-Squash-in-the-Oven-Step-26Bullet2.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/2/29/Cook-Butternut-Squash-in-the-Oven-Step-26Bullet2.jpg/v4-759px-Cook-Butternut-Squash-in-the-Oven-Step-26Bullet2.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":306,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":506.31868131868134,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"}
sentences:
Roasted[1]
	X
		Research source Preheat the oven to 350 degrees Fahrenheit (180 degrees Celsius).
Prepare a roasting pan or deep baking dish by lightly coating the bottom with cooking spray.
You could also coat the pan in butter or cover it with aluminum foil to prevent the squash from sticking to the bottom.

{"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/d\/d6\/Cook-Butternut-Squash-in-the-Oven-Step-1Bullet1.jpg\/v4-459px-Cook-Butternut-Squash-in-the-Oven-Step-1Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/d\/d6\/Cook-Butternut-Squash-in-the-Oven-Step-1Bullet1.jpg\/v4-759px-Cook-Butternut-Squash-in-the-Oven-Step-1Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":306,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":506.31868131868134,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons<\/a>
\n<\/p>


\n<\/p><\/div>"} Divide the squash into quarters.
Use a sharp serrated knife to cut the squash into quarters lengthwise.
Cut the squash in half from top to bottom.
Use a sawing motion.

{"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/8\/81\/Cook-Butternut-Squash-in-the-Oven-Step-2Bullet1.jpg\/v4-459px-Cook-Butternut-Squash-in-the-Oven-Step-2Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/8\/81\/Cook-Butternut-Squash-in-the-Oven-Step-2Bullet1.jpg\/v4-759px-Cook-Butternut-Squash-in-the-Oven-Step-2Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":306,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":506.31868131868134,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons<\/a>
\n<\/p>


\n<\/p><\/div>"} Cut each half in half, again working from top to bottom in a sawing motion.

{"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/a\/a8\/Cook-Butternut-Squash-in-the-Oven-Step-2Bullet2.jpg\/v4-459px-Cook-Butternut-Squash-in-the-Oven-Step-2Bullet2.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/a\/a8\/Cook-Butternut-Squash-in-the-Oven-Step-2Bullet2.jpg\/v4-759px-Cook-Butternut-Squash-in-the-Oven-Step-2Bullet2.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":306,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":506.31868131868134,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons<\/a>
\n<\/p>


\n<\/p><\/div>"} Peeling the squash is not necessary.

{"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/a\/a4\/Cook-Butternut-Squash-in-the-Oven-Step-2Bullet3.jpg\/v4-459px-Cook-Butternut-Squash-in-the-Oven-Step-2Bullet3.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/a\/a4\/Cook-Butternut-Squash-in-the-Oven-Step-2Bullet3.jpg\/v4-759px-Cook-Butternut-Squash-in-the-Oven-Step-2Bullet3.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":306,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":506.31868131868134,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons<\/a>
\n<\/p>


\n<\/p><\/div>"} Use a metal spoon or melon-baller to remove the seeds and stringy pulp.

{"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/f\/fd\/Cook-Butternut-Squash-in-the-Oven-Step-2Bullet4.jpg\/v4-459px-Cook-Butternut-Squash-in-the-Oven-Step-2Bullet4.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/f\/fd\/Cook-Butternut-Squash-in-the-Oven-Step-2Bullet4.jpg\/v4-759px-Cook-Butternut-Squash-in-the-Oven-Step-2Bullet4.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":306,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":506.31868131868134,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons<\/a>
\n<\/p>


\n<\/p><\/div>"} Place the squash in your prepared roasting pan.
The quarters should be cut-side up.
Cover the squash with oil, butter, salt, and pepper.
Coat the upward-facing, cut-side of each quarter.
Drizzle a generous amount of olive oil over each quarter.

{"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/7\/75\/Cook-Butternut-Squash-in-the-Oven-Step-4Bullet1.jpg\/v4-459px-Cook-Butternut-Squash-in-the-Oven-Step-4Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/7\/75\/Cook-Butternut-Squash-in-the-Oven-Step-4Bullet1.jpg\/v4-759px-Cook-Butternut-Squash-in-the-Oven-Step-4Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":306,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":506.31868131868134,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons<\/a>
\n<\/p>


\n<\/p><\/div>"} Divide the butter equally among all the quarters.
Dot the cut surface with small chunks of butter.

{"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/e\/ec\/Cook-Butternut-Squash-in-the-Oven-Step-4Bullet2.jpg\/v4-459px-Cook-Butternut-Squash-in-the-Oven-Step-4Bullet2.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/e\/ec\/Cook-Butternut-Squash-in-the-Oven-Step-4Bullet2.jpg\/v4-759px-Cook-Butternut-Squash-in-the-Oven-Step-4Bullet2.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":306,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":506.31868131868134,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons<\/a>
\n<\/p>


\n<\/p><\/div>"} Sprinkle salt and pepper over the squash.
This should be done according to taste, but if you are uncertain where to start, use roughly 1/4 tsp (1.25 ml) salt and 1/8 tsp (0.62 ml) pepper per quarter.

{"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/4\/45\/Cook-Butternut-Squash-in-the-Oven-Step-4Bullet3.jpg\/v4-459px-Cook-Butternut-Squash-in-the-Oven-Step-4Bullet3.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/4\/45\/Cook-Butternut-Squash-in-the-Oven-Step-4Bullet3.jpg\/v4-759px-Cook-Butternut-Squash-in-the-Oven-Step-4Bullet3.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":306,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":506.31868131868134,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons<\/a>
\n<\/p>


\n<\/p><\/div>"} Additional herbs and seasonings can also be used.
For instance, you can sprinkle the squash with thyme or parsley for a savory taste or a dash of red pepper for a spicier flavor.

{"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/2\/2b\/Cook-Butternut-Squash-in-the-Oven-Step-4Bullet4.jpg\/v4-459px-Cook-Butternut-Squash-in-the-Oven-Step-4Bullet4.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/2\/2b\/Cook-Butternut-Squash-in-the-Oven-Step-4Bullet4.jpg\/v4-759px-Cook-Butternut-Squash-in-the-Oven-Step-4Bullet4.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":306,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":506.31868131868134,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons<\/a>
\n<\/p>


\n<\/p><\/div>"} Roast for 45 to 50 minutes.
The squash should be tender enough to stick a fork into.
The entire squash may not be browned, but you should begin seeing golden-brown patches developing, especially along the edges.

{"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/2\/2a\/Cook-Butternut-Squash-in-the-Oven-Step-5Bullet1.jpg\/v4-459px-Cook-Butternut-Squash-in-the-Oven-Step-5Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/2\/2a\/Cook-Butternut-Squash-in-the-Oven-Step-5Bullet1.jpg\/v4-759px-Cook-Butternut-Squash-in-the-Oven-Step-5Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":306,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":506.31868131868134,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons<\/a>
\n<\/p>


\n<\/p><\/div>"} Remove from oven.
Let cool slightly before serving warm.

Baked Whole[2]
	X
		Research source Preheat the oven to 350 degrees Fahrenheit (180 degrees Celsius).
Prepare a baking sheet with shallow sides.
You do not need to grease the baking sheet, but if desired, you can spread a layer of nonstick aluminum foil over the bottom to prevent the squash from sticking to the pan.

{"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/f\/fb\/Cook-Butternut-Squash-in-the-Oven-Step-7Bullet1.jpg\/v4-459px-Cook-Butternut-Squash-in-the-Oven-Step-7Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/f\/fb\/Cook-Butternut-Squash-in-the-Oven-Step-7Bullet1.jpg\/v4-759px-Cook-Butternut-Squash-in-the-Oven-Step-7Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":306,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":506.31868131868134,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons<\/a>
\n<\/p>


\n<\/p><\/div>"} Place squash onto the baking sheet.
Use a sharp knife to prick the squash in several places.
Each prick should be between 1 and 2 inches (2.5 and 5 cm) deep, and the pricks should be roughly 3 to 4 inches (7.6 and 10.2 cm) apart.

{"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/7\/76\/Cook-Butternut-Squash-in-the-Oven-Step-8Bullet1.jpg\/v4-459px-Cook-Butternut-Squash-in-the-Oven-Step-8Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/7\/76\/Cook-Butternut-Squash-in-the-Oven-Step-8Bullet1.jpg\/v4-759px-Cook-Butternut-Squash-in-the-Oven-Step-8Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":306,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":506.31868131868134,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons<\/a>
\n<\/p>


\n<\/p><\/div>"} Bake for 60 minutes.
The squash should be tender enough to easily stick a fork into.
Leave the squash uncovered as you bake it.

{"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/f\/fa\/Cook-Butternut-Squash-in-the-Oven-Step-9Bullet1.jpg\/v4-459px-Cook-Butternut-Squash-in-the-Oven-Step-9Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/f\/fa\/Cook-Butternut-Squash-in-the-Oven-Step-9Bullet1.jpg\/v4-759px-Cook-Butternut-Squash-in-the-Oven-Step-9Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":306,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":506.31868131868134,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons<\/a>
\n<\/p>


\n<\/p><\/div>"} Remove from oven and cut in half.
Allow the squash to cool slightly before cutting it in half lengthwise.
Wait at least 10 to 15 minutes after pulling the squash out of the oven.
Otherwise, it might be too hot for you to handle, and you could end up burning your fingers.

{"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/b\/be\/Cook-Butternut-Squash-in-the-Oven-Step-10Bullet1.jpg\/v4-459px-Cook-Butternut-Squash-in-the-Oven-Step-10Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/b\/be\/Cook-Butternut-Squash-in-the-Oven-Step-10Bullet1.jpg\/v4-759px-Cook-Butternut-Squash-in-the-Oven-Step-10Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":306,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":506.31868131868134,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons<\/a>
\n<\/p>


\n<\/p><\/div>"} Use a serrated knife to split the squash open from top to bottom.

{"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/0\/00\/Cook-Butternut-Squash-in-the-Oven-Step-10Bullet2.jpg\/v4-459px-Cook-Butternut-Squash-in-the-Oven-Step-10Bullet2.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/0\/00\/Cook-Butternut-Squash-in-the-Oven-Step-10Bullet2.jpg\/v4-759px-Cook-Butternut-Squash-in-the-Oven-Step-10Bullet2.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":306,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":506.31868131868134,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons<\/a>
\n<\/p>


\n<\/p><\/div>"} Dig out the seeds and stringy fibers with a metal spoon or melon-baller.

{"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/c\/c8\/Cook-Butternut-Squash-in-the-Oven-Step-10Bullet3.jpg\/v4-459px-Cook-Butternut-Squash-in-the-Oven-Step-10Bullet3.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/c\/c8\/Cook-Butternut-Squash-in-the-Oven-Step-10Bullet3.jpg\/v4-759px-Cook-Butternut-Squash-in-the-Oven-Step-10Bullet3.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":306,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":506.31868131868134,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons<\/a>
\n<\/p>


\n<\/p><\/div>"} Season the squash and serve it.
Sprinkle it with salt and pepper, to taste.
Use as much salt and pepper as desired.
If you are uncertain about how much to use, start with 1/2 tsp (2.5 ml) salt and 1/4 tsp (1.25 ml) pepper per half.

{"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/4\/4b\/Cook-Butternut-Squash-in-the-Oven-Step-11Bullet1.jpg\/v4-459px-Cook-Butternut-Squash-in-the-Oven-Step-11Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/4\/4b\/Cook-Butternut-Squash-in-the-Oven-Step-11Bullet1.jpg\/v4-759px-Cook-Butternut-Squash-in-the-Oven-Step-11Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":306,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":506.31868131868134,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons<\/a>
\n<\/p>


\n<\/p><\/div>"} If desired, you can also drizzle the halves with melted butter or a little olive oil.

{"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/0\/08\/Cook-Butternut-Squash-in-the-Oven-Step-11Bullet2.jpg\/v4-459px-Cook-Butternut-Squash-in-the-Oven-Step-11Bullet2.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/0\/08\/Cook-Butternut-Squash-in-the-Oven-Step-11Bullet2.jpg\/v4-759px-Cook-Butternut-Squash-in-the-Oven-Step-11Bullet2.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":357,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":590.2912621359224,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons<\/a>
\n<\/p>


\n<\/p><\/div>"} For a tangier twist, consider drizzling the squash with lime juice.

{"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/d\/de\/Cook-Butternut-Squash-in-the-Oven-Step-11Bullet3.jpg\/v4-459px-Cook-Butternut-Squash-in-the-Oven-Step-11Bullet3.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/d\/de\/Cook-Butternut-Squash-in-the-Oven-Step-11Bullet3.jpg\/v4-759px-Cook-Butternut-Squash-in-the-Oven-Step-11Bullet3.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":306,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":506.31868131868134,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons<\/a>
\n<\/p>


\n<\/p><\/div>"} To make the squash easier to serve, you may wish to cut the halves in half again, ultimately dividing the squash into quarters.

{"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/4\/47\/Cook-Butternut-Squash-in-the-Oven-Step-11Bullet4.jpg\/v4-459px-Cook-Butternut-Squash-in-the-Oven-Step-11Bullet4.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/4\/47\/Cook-Butternut-Squash-in-the-Oven-Step-11Bullet4.jpg\/v4-759px-Cook-Butternut-Squash-in-the-Oven-Step-11Bullet4.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":306,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":506.31868131868134,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons<\/a>
\n<\/p>


\n<\/p><\/div>"} Charbroiled[3] X Research source Preheat oven to 425 degrees Fahrenheit (218 degrees Celsius).
Line a large baking sheet with shallow sides using parchment paper or nonstick aluminum foil.
Peel and slice the squash.
Use a vegetable peeler to shave off the peel and a sharp knife to cut the squash into 1-inch (2.5-cm) slices.
Cut 1 inch (2.5 cm) from the top and bottom of the squash.
Discard pieces.

{"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/a\/af\/Cook-Butternut-Squash-in-the-Oven-Step-13Bullet1.jpg\/v4-459px-Cook-Butternut-Squash-in-the-Oven-Step-13Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/a\/af\/Cook-Butternut-Squash-in-the-Oven-Step-13Bullet1.jpg\/v4-759px-Cook-Butternut-Squash-in-the-Oven-Step-13Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":306,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":506.31868131868134,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons<\/a>
\n<\/p>


\n<\/p><\/div>"} Use a serrated vegetable peeler to remove the thick skin until you reveal the orange flesh beneath.

{"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/f\/f2\/Cook-Butternut-Squash-in-the-Oven-Step-13Bullet2.jpg\/v4-459px-Cook-Butternut-Squash-in-the-Oven-Step-13Bullet2.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/f\/f2\/Cook-Butternut-Squash-in-the-Oven-Step-13Bullet2.jpg\/v4-759px-Cook-Butternut-Squash-in-the-Oven-Step-13Bullet2.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":306,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":506.31868131868134,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons<\/a>
\n<\/p>


\n<\/p><\/div>"} Use a metal spoon or melon-baller to scoop out the seeds and fibers inside.

{"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/6\/6d\/Cook-Butternut-Squash-in-the-Oven-Step-13Bullet3.jpg\/v4-459px-Cook-Butternut-Squash-in-the-Oven-Step-13Bullet3.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/6\/6d\/Cook-Butternut-Squash-in-the-Oven-Step-13Bullet3.jpg\/v4-759px-Cook-Butternut-Squash-in-the-Oven-Step-13Bullet3.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":306,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":506.31868131868134,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons<\/a>
\n<\/p>


\n<\/p><\/div>"} Make width-wise slices, cutting from side to side, that are each about 1 inch (2.5 cm) thick.

{"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/c\/ce\/Cook-Butternut-Squash-in-the-Oven-Step-13Bullet4.jpg\/v4-459px-Cook-Butternut-Squash-in-the-Oven-Step-13Bullet4.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/c\/ce\/Cook-Butternut-Squash-in-the-Oven-Step-13Bullet4.jpg\/v4-759px-Cook-Butternut-Squash-in-the-Oven-Step-13Bullet4.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":306,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":506.31868131868134,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons<\/a>
\n<\/p>


\n<\/p><\/div>"} Coat the squash with oil.
Drizzle the oil over the baking sheet and directly over the slices.
Olive oil works well, but you can also use walnut oil or other types of vegetable oil.
Drizzle half of the olive oil over the baking sheet.
Dredge each slice in the oil, turning it over so that both sides get covered.

{"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/1\/14\/Cook-Butternut-Squash-in-the-Oven-Step-14Bullet2.jpg\/v4-459px-Cook-Butternut-Squash-in-the-Oven-Step-14Bullet2.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/1\/14\/Cook-Butternut-Squash-in-the-Oven-Step-14Bullet2.jpg\/v4-759px-Cook-Butternut-Squash-in-the-Oven-Step-14Bullet2.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":306,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":506.31868131868134,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons<\/a>
\n<\/p>


\n<\/p><\/div>"} Drizzle the remaining oil directly over each slice.

{"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/5\/52\/Cook-Butternut-Squash-in-the-Oven-Step-14Bullet3.jpg\/v4-459px-Cook-Butternut-Squash-in-the-Oven-Step-14Bullet3.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/5\/52\/Cook-Butternut-Squash-in-the-Oven-Step-14Bullet3.jpg\/v4-759px-Cook-Butternut-Squash-in-the-Oven-Step-14Bullet3.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":306,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":506.31868131868134,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons<\/a>
\n<\/p>


\n<\/p><\/div>"} If desired, you can also spray the slices with cooking spray.

{"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/0\/0c\/Cook-Butternut-Squash-in-the-Oven-Step-14Bullet4.jpg\/v4-459px-Cook-Butternut-Squash-in-the-Oven-Step-14Bullet4.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/0\/0c\/Cook-Butternut-Squash-in-the-Oven-Step-14Bullet4.jpg\/v4-759px-Cook-Butternut-Squash-in-the-Oven-Step-14Bullet4.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":306,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":506.31868131868134,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons<\/a>
\n<\/p>


\n<\/p><\/div>"} Sprinkle the squash with salt.
The amount of salt you use is a matter of personal taste, but start with anywhere from 1/2 to 1 tsp (2.5 to 5 ml) for the entire batch if you are uncertain.
Bake for 15 to 20 minutes.
The slices should begin to turn a slight golden brown around the edges.
Turn the slices and continue baking.
Flip each slice and sprinkle with additional salt.
Continue baking for 15 more minutes.
Use tongs to flip the slices since they will be too hot to handle with your bare hands.

{"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/a\/a8\/Cook-Butternut-Squash-in-the-Oven-Step-17Bullet1.jpg\/v4-459px-Cook-Butternut-Squash-in-the-Oven-Step-17Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/a\/a8\/Cook-Butternut-Squash-in-the-Oven-Step-17Bullet1.jpg\/v4-759px-Cook-Butternut-Squash-in-the-Oven-Step-17Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":306,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":506.31868131868134,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons<\/a>
\n<\/p>


\n<\/p><\/div>"} Switch on the broiler.
If your broiler has multiple settings, switch it to the low setting.
Broil for 5 minutes.
The squash should begin to turn dark brown in some places.
Monitor the squash closely.
If some portions cook faster than others, remove them first.
Serve warm.
After pulling the charbroiled slices out of the oven, let cool for 5 minutes or so and serve warm.

Steam-Baked[4]
	X
		Research source Preheat the oven to 350 degrees Fahrenheit (180 degrees Celsius).
Prepare a 9- by 13-inch (23- by 33-cm) glass baking dish.
Greasing the dish or covering it with aluminum foil is unnecessary.
Cut the squash in half.
Use a sharp serrated knife to divide the squash in half lengthwise.
Cut the squash in half from top to bottom.

{"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/9\/9a\/Cook-Butternut-Squash-in-the-Oven-Step-22Bullet1.jpg\/v4-459px-Cook-Butternut-Squash-in-the-Oven-Step-22Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/9\/9a\/Cook-Butternut-Squash-in-the-Oven-Step-22Bullet1.jpg\/v4-759px-Cook-Butternut-Squash-in-the-Oven-Step-22Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":306,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":506.31868131868134,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons<\/a>
\n<\/p>


\n<\/p><\/div>"} Peeling is not necessary or desired.

{"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/f\/f5\/Cook-Butternut-Squash-in-the-Oven-Step-22Bullet2.jpg\/v4-459px-Cook-Butternut-Squash-in-the-Oven-Step-22Bullet2.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/f\/f5\/Cook-Butternut-Squash-in-the-Oven-Step-22Bullet2.jpg\/v4-759px-Cook-Butternut-Squash-in-the-Oven-Step-22Bullet2.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":306,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":506.31868131868134,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons<\/a>
\n<\/p>


\n<\/p><\/div>"} Scoop out the seeds and pulp with a metal spoon or melon-baller.

{"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/d\/d5\/Cook-Butternut-Squash-in-the-Oven-Step-22Bullet3.jpg\/v4-459px-Cook-Butternut-Squash-in-the-Oven-Step-22Bullet3.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/d\/d5\/Cook-Butternut-Squash-in-the-Oven-Step-22Bullet3.jpg\/v4-759px-Cook-Butternut-Squash-in-the-Oven-Step-22Bullet3.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":306,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":506.31868131868134,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons<\/a>
\n<\/p>


\n<\/p><\/div>"} Place the squash in the baking dish and fill with water.
The halves should be cut-side down.
Add 1/2 cup (125 ml) cool to lukewarm water to the dish.
The water helps to prevent the squash from sticking and also creates steam, which aids in the cooking process.
Cover with foil.
Tightly cover the top of the dish with aluminum foil.
If using nonstick foil, make sure that the nonstick side faces down toward the squash.

{"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/4\/48\/Cook-Butternut-Squash-in-the-Oven-Step-24Bullet1.jpg\/v4-459px-Cook-Butternut-Squash-in-the-Oven-Step-24Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/4\/48\/Cook-Butternut-Squash-in-the-Oven-Step-24Bullet1.jpg\/v4-759px-Cook-Butternut-Squash-in-the-Oven-Step-24Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":306,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":506.31868131868134,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons<\/a>
\n<\/p>


\n<\/p><\/div>"} Pinch the foil around the edges of the baking dish to ensure a tight seal.
Bake for 60 minutes.
The squash should be tender enough to poke with a fork after it finishes.
You may not notice any change in color.

{"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/1\/10\/Cook-Butternut-Squash-in-the-Oven-Step-25Bullet1.jpg\/v4-459px-Cook-Butternut-Squash-in-the-Oven-Step-25Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/1\/10\/Cook-Butternut-Squash-in-the-Oven-Step-25Bullet1.jpg\/v4-759px-Cook-Butternut-Squash-in-the-Oven-Step-25Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":306,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":506.31868131868134,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons<\/a>
\n<\/p>


\n<\/p><\/div>"} Mash the inside of the squash with butter, brown sugar, and cinnamon.
If desired, scoop out the softened flesh and place it into a large bowl.
Use a potato masher to mash brown sugar, butter, and cinnamon into the squash.
Wait several minutes after pulling the squash out of the oven before handling it.

{"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/7\/7f\/Cook-Butternut-Squash-in-the-Oven-Step-26Bullet1.jpg\/v4-459px-Cook-Butternut-Squash-in-the-Oven-Step-26Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/7\/7f\/Cook-Butternut-Squash-in-the-Oven-Step-26Bullet1.jpg\/v4-759px-Cook-Butternut-Squash-in-the-Oven-Step-26Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":306,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":506.31868131868134,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons<\/a>
\n<\/p>


\n<\/p><\/div>"} You can also serve the squash without mashing it.
Simply divide the squash into quarters or however many pieces you desire.
Sprinkle it with brown sugar, butter, and cinnamon, or try different seasonings, like salt and pepper.

{"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/2\/29\/Cook-Butternut-Squash-in-the-Oven-Step-26Bullet2.jpg\/v4-459px-Cook-Butternut-Squash-in-the-Oven-Step-26Bullet2.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/2\/29\/Cook-Butternut-Squash-in-the-Oven-Step-26Bullet2.jpg\/v4-759px-Cook-Butternut-Squash-in-the-Oven-Step-26Bullet2.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":306,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":506.31868131868134,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons<\/a>
\n<\/p>


\n<\/p><\/div>"}
